neighbors.name: Lawrence D. Meyer & Mary Y. Meyer
neighbors.claims: Lawrence D. and Mary Y. Meyer own a large farm holding in Wyandotte County, with appraisal records indicating it has been assessed as agricultural land for over five decades [Wyandotte County Appraiser](https://appr.wycokck.org/Property-Detail/PropertyQuickRefID/R63045). They have not been noted in local civic roles or public discussions on development in available records [Wyandotte County Extension](https://www.wyandotte.k-state.edu/about/extension_council/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a trusted local figure who can acknowledge their long tenure. Emphasize respect for their family’s land legacy and listen to any concerns about preserving their farm use or heritage.

neighbors.name: Cory M. Appl & Stefanie L. Appl
neighbors.claims: Cory Appl has lived in the Piper area of Wyandotte County for approximately 19 years and works as a home health care administrator [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/tag/election-2015/). In 2015, he ran for a seat on the Piper School Board, emphasizing the need for adequate school facilities and fiscally responsible budgets to keep the community attractive to families [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/tag/election-2015/). Appl has volunteered as a youth basketball coach and his wife, Stefanie, has served as an on-call school nurse in the district, reflecting their active involvement in local community and schools [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/tag/election-2015/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through school or community meetings, highlighting how development plans support local services and property values. Connect on shared community goals (e.g., quality schools) to address any concerns within a collaborative, locally-driven dialogue.

neighbors.name: Jennifer Masters
neighbors.claims: Jennifer Masters is listed as the owner of a large agricultural tract in the county (approximately 152 acres), with historical appraisal data (circa 1974) reflecting longstanding farm use of the property [Wyandotte County Appraiser](https://appr.wycokck.org/Property-Detail/PropertyQuickRefID/R59670). There are no public records of Masters holding any local office or voicing opinions on development issues in the community as of this report [Wyandotte County Extension](https://www.wyandotte.k-state.edu/about/extension_council/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally to understand her perspective since she has not been publicly active. A one-on-one approach via a mutual acquaintance or local community leader may help build trust and uncover any private concerns she might have.

overview_summary: Three neighboring landowners were reviewed; none have a clear public stance on development, and all are long-time local residents. One neighbor (Appl) has moderate community influence through school and civic involvement, while the others appear to have low public profiles or influence.
